title.narrative: Demonstration of flight simulators for General Aviation Market

description.narrative: TRC Simulators (TRC) was found in 1999 and develops, builds and markets flight simulators for small single and twin engine airplanes. These flight simulators are aimed at the General Aviation market; ie. the 'private transport' and recreational components of aviation. The most common and most well-known plane in the General Aviation market is the Cessna 172. In order to obtain and to keep their licenses pilots need to train regularly in flight simulators thus creating a large demand forsimulators.For this market TRC develops desktop simulators, fixed base simulators and full motion simulators. This proposal is about the demonstration of two fixed base simulators in the United States.Where most competitors sell ‘generic’ flight simulators which consist of programmable screens, the strategy of TRC is different.The products being developed by TRC make use of real controls creating a more realistic and immersive simulation environment for the user. All components used in these simulators are developed by TRC themselves: they develop the software, the hardware and controls.TRC already sells quite a few simulators to customers abroad. Customers are located in other EU countries, but also China, Singapore, Hong Kong, Australia, Indonesia, Bahrein, Abu Dhabi and Uganda.The next market TRC wants to approach is the American domestic market.
